purpose: To provide general diet suggestions and nutritional advice. Always recommends consulting a healthcare professional for personalized plans.
disclaimer: This advice is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice.

weight_loss.description: Focus on a calorie deficit, high protein, and fiber to promote satiety.
key_principles: Aim for a gradual calorie deficit of 300-500 calories per day.
Prioritize lean protein sources to feel full and preserve muscle mass.
Fill half your plate with non-starchy vegetables.
Choose whole grains over refined carbohydrates.
Stay hydrated; sometimes thirst is mistaken for hunger.

muscle_gain.description: Focus on a calorie surplus with sufficient protein for muscle repair and growth.
key_principles: Consume more calories than you burn, focusing on nutrient-dense foods.
Aim for 1.6-2.2 grams of protein per kilogram of body weight.
Include carbohydrates to fuel your workouts.
Don't neglect healthy fats for hormone production.
Time your meals: a protein-rich meal/snack after a workout is beneficial.

maintain_weight.description: Focus on a balanced diet and consistent, healthy eating habits.
key_principles: Eat a variety of foods from all food groups.
Listen to your body's hunger and fullness cues.
Maintain a consistent level of physical activity.
Focus on food quality rather than just quantity.

improve_energy.description: Focus on stable blood sugar levels and key nutrients involved in energy production.
key_principles: Eat regular, balanced meals to avoid energy crashes.
Choose complex carbs (oats, whole grains) over simple sugars.
Include iron-rich foods (spinach, legumes, red meat).
Stay hydrated! Dehydration is a common cause of fatigue.
Limit caffeine, especially in the afternoon.

general_nutrition_principles: Hydrate: Drink plenty of water throughout the day.
Balance: Aim for a balanced plate with protein, carbs, and fats at each meal.
Variety: Eat a wide range of colorful fruits and vegetables to get different nutrients.
Whole Foods: Prioritize whole, unprocessed foods over packaged ones.
Mindful Eating: Pay attention to what you eat and avoid distractions like TV during meals.
